articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: The mayor of a major town in south Lebanon was among 16 people killed when an Israeli airstrike destroyed its municipal headquarters in the biggest attack on an official Lebanese state building since the Israeli air campaign began.
articles.title: 16 dead in Israeli strike on Lebanese municipality building

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: China is building its capacity to rapidly turn military drills into a full-out attack, a senior Taiwan security official said, providing the Taipei government's assessment of the strategic intent behind Beijing's war games around the island this week.
articles.title: China building capacity to rapidly strike Taiwan, senior Taiwanese official says

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy takes his "victory plan" to the European Union and NATO on Thursday, pitching for a NATO membership invitation and a major increase in military support for Kyiv's campaign against Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to pitch 'victory plan' to EU, NATO

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has designated South Korea a "hostile state", its state media said on Thursday, confirming that its national assembly had amended the country's constitution in line with their leader's vow to drop unification as a national goal.
articles.title: North Korea calls South Korea 'hostile state' indicating constitution change

articles.author: James Oliphant
articles.description: After dodging the issue for weeks, Republican vice-presidential candidate JD Vance said unequivocally on Wednesday he believes false claims that Donald Trump did not lose the 2020 election.
articles.title: JD Vance says Trump did not lose the 2020 US election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's ruling party may lose its sole majority in the lower house for the first time in 15 years, the Nikkei newspaper said on Thursday, citing its poll ahead of the Oct. 27 election.
articles.title: Japan's ruling LDP at risk of losing majority in election, Nikkei poll shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Wednesday India made "a horrific mistake" by thinking it could interfere as aggressively as it allegedly did in Canada's sovereignty.
articles.title: India's alleged interference in Canada was 'horrific mistake,' Trudeau says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazil's Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes instructed the government to request the extradition of 63 Brazilian nationals currently in Argentina who are linked to an alleged 2023 coup attempt, the court said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Brazil seeks extradition of January 8 rioters currently in Argentina

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States conducted precision strikes on Wednesday against five underground weapons storage locations in Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen, U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said in a statement.
articles.title: U.S. forces target underground Houthi weapons storage sites in Yemen

articles.author: Dewi Kurniawati
articles.description: Indonesian sixth-grader Shakila Fitriyani, a day labourer's daughter who dreams of becoming a doctor, says she is keener to go to school these days because she is served a free lunch.
articles.title: Indonesia's free meals plan in the spotlight as Prabowo readies for office
